title: Vast Forest Coverage
description: In 2022, Suriname had 94.52% of its land area covered by forests, one of the highest percentages in the world.

title: Minimal Agricultural Land
description: As of 2022, only 0.45% of Suriname's land area was used for agriculture, one of the lowest percentages globally.

title: High External Debt Burden
description: In 2023, the present value of Suriname's external debt was 84.36% of its GNI, indicating a significant debt burden.

title: Long Wait for Electrical Connections
description: In 2018, it took an average of 262.3 days to obtain an electrical connection in Suriname, one of the longest durations worldwide.

title: High Rate of Girls Out of School
description: As of 2023, 82.81% of primary school-aged girls in Suriname were out of school, a concerningly high percentage.

title: Low Male Progression to Secondary School
description: In 2017, only 59.94% of male students in Suriname progressed to secondary school, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Low Exclusive Breastfeeding Rates
description: In 2018, only 8.92% of children under 6 months in Suriname were exclusively breastfed, one of the lowest rates worldwide.
